Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies

Interface PlayStrategy

All Known Implementing Classes:
CPUStrategy, DefensiveStrategy, GropingStrategy, OffensiveStrategy
public interface PlayStrategy

  • Method Details

    • selectIdentity

      Identity selectIdentity()

      Chooses an identity.

      VILLAGER is more suited for a player with an aggressive playstyle, while WITCH corresponds better to a player with a defensive or careful playstyle

      Returns:
      Either VILLAGER or WITCH.
      See Also:
      • Identity
      • CPUPlayer::chooseIdentity()

    • selectTurnAction

      TurnAction selectTurnAction(Identity identity, RumourCardsPile myHand, boolean canHunt)

      Selects a turn action.

      A defensive and careful strategy will tend to avoid hunting.

      To make this choice, requires knowledge of the calling player's identity, hand and ability to play a Hunt! effect.

      Parameters:
      identity - The calling cpu-controlled player's identity.
      myHand - The calling cpu-controlled player's hand.
      canHunt - A boolean indicating whether the calling cpu-controlled player can or can't hunt.
      Returns:
      Either ACCUSE or HUNT.
      See Also:
      • TurnAction
      • CPUPlayer::chooseTurnAction()

    • selectDefenseAction

      DefenseAction selectDefenseAction(Identity myIdentity, RumourCardsPile myHand, boolean canWitch)

      Selects an answer to an accusation.

      To make this choice, requires knowledge of the calling player's identity, hand and ability to play a Witch? effect.

      Parameters:
      myIdentity - The calling cpu-controlled player's identity.
      myHand - The calling cpu-controlled player's hand.
      canWitch - A boolean indicating whether the calling cpu-controlled player can or can't play a Witch? effect.
      Returns:
      Either REVEAL or WITCH.
      See Also:
      • DefenseAction
      • Player::defend()

    • selectPlayerToAccuse

      Player selectPlayerToAccuse(List<Player> accusablePlayersList)

      Selects a player to accuse within a list.

      Parameters:
      accusablePlayersList - The list within which a player must be accused
      Returns:
      The chosen target
      See Also:
      • Player.accuse(Player)

    • selectTarget

      default Player selectTarget(List<Player> eligiblePlayers)

      Selects a player to target with a Hunt! effect.

      Parameters:
      eligiblePlayers - The list within which a player must be targetted
      Returns:
      The chosen target
      See Also:
      • Player.chooseHuntedTarget(List)

    • selectWitchCard

      RumourCard selectWitchCard(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Selects a Rumour card valued for its Witch? effect within a given pile of Rumour cards.
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the choice can be made.
      Returns:
      A Rumour card from the player's hand chosen for its Witch? effect in particular.
      See Also:
      • CPUPlayer.selectWitchCard()
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap

    • selectHuntCard

      RumourCard selectHuntCard(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Selects a Rumour card valued for its Hunt! effect within a given pile of Rumour cards.
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the choice can be made.
      Returns:
      A Rumour card from the player's hand chosen for its Hunt! effect in particular.
      See Also:
      • CPUPlayer.selectHuntCard()
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap

    • selectCardToDiscard

      RumourCard selectCardToDiscard(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Selects a Rumour card to discard within a given a given pile of Rumour cards.
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which a card must be selected to be discarded.
      Returns:
      The selected Rumour card, supposed to be the worst one according to the strategy
      See Also:
      • discard
      • CPUStrategy.selectWorstCard(RumourCardsPile)
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap

    • selectNextPlayer

      Player selectNextPlayer(List<Player> list)

      Selects a player to take the next turn.

      Most strategies will avoid giving the next turn to the leading players.

      Parameters:
      list - A list of players within which the next player has to be selected.
      Returns:
      The chosen player to take the next turn.
      See Also:
      • CPUPlayer::chooseNextPlayer()

    • selectBestCard

      RumourCard selectBestCard(RumourCardsPile rcp, boolean seeUnrevealedCards)
      Selects the best card according to the strategy within a given pile of Rumour cards.
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the best card has to be selected.
      seeUnrevealedCards - If this boolean is true, the strategy will be able to access the properties of unrevealed cards as well.
      Returns:
      The best card according to the strategy.
      See Also:
      • CPUStrategy.selectBestCard(RumourCardsPile, boolean)
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap

    • revealOrDiscard

      DefenseAction revealOrDiscard(Identity identity, RumourCardsPile rcp)

      Chooses an action between revealing your identity and discard(RumourCard) discarding a Rumour card from your hand, based on the chosen strategy.

      To make this choice, requires knowledge of the calling player's identity and hand.

      Returns:
      Either DefenseAction#REVEAL or DefenseAction#DISCARD
      See Also:
      • CPUPlayer::revealOrDiscard()
      • DefenseAction
      • DuckingStool

    • updateBehavior

      void updateBehavior(boolean amIRevealed, Identity myIdentity, RumourCardsPile myHand)

      Updates the behavior the strategy according to the player's identity, reveal status and hand.

      Parameters:
      amIRevealed - The reveal status of the calling player
      myIdentity - The calling player's identity.
      myHand - The calling player's hand.

    • toString

      String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
